direction.raw_text: of unimaginable size, a tubular freighter easily ten times larger then any aircraft carrier. At first glance it appears lifeless and adrift, but slowly the small glow of cockpit windows come into view as we move closer. Moonlight cuts across the hull, displaying the name; EDEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Where were you... when Eden was lost? Like every other kid on my block, I was in the middle of a dream, envious of those who were chosen to be part of mankind's greatest quest. Dreaming of the unknown and trying to imagine what only the lucky few would encounter. We PUSH IN towards the cockpit windows and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Inside the flight deck it's ghostly vacant, rows of empty flight chairs and numerous guidance computers gently blinking. With half filled coffee-cups and jackets hung over the seat backs... it appears the control deck has been suddenly evacuated. Muffled SCREAMS are heard somewhere deeper inside the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .(V.0.) As the entire world watched in wonder, there were only a few, skeptical of the journey's success. (BEAT) Only a few... who would be right. The further we move into the ship... signs of violence appear, smears of dark blood sharply standing out on the bright white paneling and several broken computer screens. The muffled SCREAMS grow louder and clearer... an argument between men, panicked rage over-lapping. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slowly moves past a corner to see the middle-of a violent confrontation. One OFFICER is locked inside a sleep chamber, banging on the glass and pleading with panic. Another OFFICER is on the floor, mortally wounded, his body still twitching with his head bashed in. The INSANE OFFICER, a young corporal is moving from terminal to terminal, typing in commands with a casual and emotionless nature. Blood streams have run down his face from both ears and nose as he continues to type commands into the flight computer... heightening the trapped OFFICER'S muffled,. screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STOP IT! STOP FOR GOD'S SAKES! PLEASE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The INSANE OFFICER hits the final command key and warning buzzers ignite with flashing lights. He closes his eyes, taking a breath of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STOP IT! YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT THIS WILL DO TO- YOU'RE NOT- STOP! YOU'RE GOING TO FUCKING KILL US ALL! The trapped OFFICER begins pounding on the glass with a crazed panic as the INSANE OFFICER calmly goes to his own sleep-pod and climbs inside, sealing the hatch.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT THIS WILL DO TO- YOU'RE NOT- STOP
YOU'RE GOING TO FUCKING KILL US ALL

direction.raw_text: (IN FRENCH)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! NO! NO GOD DAMMIT! Control panels flash and hydraulics ignite. Like a row of tumbling dominos, each of the sleep-chamber pods shift positions with a SHUSH of hydraulics and then... they are launched with a ROAR of micro-jets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We're suddenly back into the unsettling silence as... like a bee hive that's exploded, thousands of coffin-sized sleep pods are ejected from the ship in unison. They are sent tumbling into open space in every direction as the ship slowly continues its unaffected course. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trapped OFFICER is seen SCREAMING in silence inside his own pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We slowly float towards an astroid field. As we grow closer it's the sea of sleep pods slowly floating through space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (P.O.) Where was I... when I heard we'd lost Eden? Just like every other kid on my block... I was dreaming... of being one who would be chosen to follow. As we move closer to the asteroid field of sleep pods, it's obvious that time has passed, a single skeleton inside each of the pods, hands in a clawing position towards the glass. We PUSH IN towards one pod, moving towards the SKULL, still locked in a SCREAMING position, wide mouthed and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: M. HYPER-SLEEP CHAMBER A RUMBLE passes... EYELIDS TWITCH... A GASP. Inside a coffin-size chamber, a dim glow of light seeps through a small glass porthole. A MAN is asleep, a mask attached to his face, tubes of liquid feeding into his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: military physique, chiseled features. His chest lightly expanding, blood pulsating through his veins. Lights FLICKER PAST and his body comes to life, muscles flinching, breath quickening. He squirms with discomfort, ripping away the mask. He gasps, trying to SCREAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . His scream is muffled under three inches of glass. The hatch door is hit with a THUD and white gases erupt from the edges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... THUD! The door bursts open and BOWER scampers out, struggling to rip away the feeding tubes. He HITS the floor, naked and gasping. His pores ignite, dripping sweat. He tries to get to his feet, but his legs wobble underneath him, collapsing. He yells at the floor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burns are red! Bruises... blue- His voice echoes into the dark, alone in a cavernous room as he pauses, struggling for orientation. He gets to his feet, muscles twitching. His short-cropped hair is... pure white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey...? HEY!!? Someone? A constant low RUMBLE is present, joined by the occasional
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and CREAK of a large ship. A SHUDDER travels through the room with a random FLICKER of LIGHTS to reveal... A massive steel compartment, tangled with technology. It's cold and institutional. High-tech computer terminals slope out of the floor. The FLICKER passes, taking us into black. We hear him: fumbling through the room, switches are thrown with no result and compartments are pulled opened and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A glow stick comes to life. He squints at his darkened surroundings with confusion. A drip of liquid catches his eye and he staggers back to his sleep pod. He grabs the dangling tubes that were ripped from his arm and he sucks on the tube, pulling as much liquid into his mouth as possible. After a few heavy gulps, he suddenly heaves towards the floor. He painfully forces himself to drink, gasping. He looks up to notice two sleep chambers next to his own. He leans closer with the glow stick to see the first one, the name plate reading; 2nd Lt. Cooper. It's EMPTY. The third pod's name plate reads; LT. PAYTON. Deep inside there is the figure of a man, asleep under a mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Payton? Lieutenant... Payton? He turns back to his own pod, seeing the name plate that reads; CORPORAL BOWER. Even this name doesn't seem familiar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bower? Bower...? The loss of memory heightens his fear even more as a shiver travels through his body while he staggers towards a nearby computer terminal. He taps the keys on a computer terminal. Nothing. He frowns, leaning closer. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he taps the keyboard, powder blooms out from under his fingers. He wipes the surface of the panel to see a thick layer of dust. Under the smear is... Elysium - Flight Systems - Operation Terminal #87153-D. He pulls focus to see... his FINGERS are trembling uncontrollably, an odd vibration of nerves. He slowly makes a fist with concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks along a row of storage lockers reading each name plate. He stops at the locker labelled; Corp. Bower. He pauses, mumbling the name once again with no recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bower. He opens the locker to see an assortment of personalized belongings, uniform and gear, none of it seeming familiar. He uses a towel to wipe off the layer of sweat and oily substance coating his body, pausing to see an identification tattoo on his forearm that reads: FLT>>005A015. He pulls on a black flight suit, emblems and military markings of rank on the chest. He pulls on shoes and a tool belt with a high powered pen-lamp. On the inside of the locker is a emergency manual card with block figures displaying breathing and stretching exercises, labelled; Hyper-Sleep Disorientation Recovery Procedures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading to himself) .in the event of mild memory loss... resulting from extended- He freezes on... A PHOTO tucked inside the door. EVALON, a beautiful young woman smiling towards camera. He stares at the-photo, his frown deepening with confusion. He checks the back for a name, but nothing. He tucks the photo into a pocket and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waves his hand over a sensor... no power. He steps in front of a heavy set of steel doors, flipping several switches and... nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: breaks open a storage bin, pulling out beverage packets and a cup, taking a seat at the control desk. With Evalon's photograph leaned against the console, he becomes lost in a gaze as he gulps down nutrient pills and stirs an instant coffee as we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a conflict in his eyes, memories trying to return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An image FLASHES past, EVALON smiling as BOWER kneels next to her, gripping her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gaze remains hollow, frown deepening as he sips the cup and... winces with disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Faa-uck! Distant THUMPS. He pans the pen-lamp across the ceiling and toward the sounds... PAYTON'S sleep chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Muffled and desperate. CRACK! Bower jumps back as someone kicks their way out from inside, the hatch bursting open. Out climbs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a man in his forties, but the rugged physique of a man half his age, lean and agile. His military-style hair cut is also pure white. Gasping for breath, he hits the floor as BOWER tries to help him. PAYTON jerks with shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa! Hey... easy! Lt. Payton? You're- Sir... whoa!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: chokes and gasps, then glances up, giving Bower a once over with a frown and a sobering tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bower. Corporal... Bower, sir. I'm the- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bower?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. You're waking from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corporal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. This is disorientation from-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: corporal... Bower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. That's right, I'm-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna get that fucking light out of my eyes, pal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rubs his face with a frown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where... are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're aboard the Elysium. From what I've
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elysium...? Where are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't... really know. There's no power in the com and I can't even-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the... rest of the crew? It's our shift? Our rotation-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe so. (CONTINUED) B.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't they suppose to be here... to wake us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir... I don't know where anyone is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes breaths, trying to regain his senses, glancing around at their darkened surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit the lights, will ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah... we're having some power problems-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who woke you up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Umm, not sure. It had to have been the flight computer. There's no one here... (off his look) .except us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cold in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabs him a towel and water container, turning back to see PAYTON doesn't waste any time, stretching his limbs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no power coming off the main grid. Can't fire any of the... (searching for word) Dynos. Can't even open the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances to the other empty sleep-chamber with a frown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off his look) Our 2nd Lieutenant? I don't know where he is. It was empty when I woke up. None of the systems are on-line. Mainframe is down, so I don't know how or why it engaged independently-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bower .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until I have two coffees you're just gonna have to repeat all this shit, so let's just idle here for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I just- Just glad to see you awake. i was... a little concerned. I didn't know what to do if-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets to his feet, stumbling. BOWER catches him under the arm as they stagger into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT`D) Easy... Lieutenant. Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: helps him to the locker room as LIGHTS FLICKER past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staggers along the row of storage lockers as BOWER helps guide him with the flashlight beam. PAYTON pauses with a frown as he glances across the name-plates, none of them seeming familiar. BOWER gestures toward the locker, the name- plate reads: LT. PAYTON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... the name on your sleep pod, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the door to see his belongings inside, a photo of WIFE (MARIANNE) inside the door. He stares at it with utter confusion. BOWER takes this in, looking to the memory recovery card inside the locker. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it says that the memory loss is only suppose to be a momentary loss that's-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very reassuring. I guess when you gamma the brain into extended REM, sometimes it can take a while to get it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls on his flight uniform and squeezes his feet into his shoes. BOWER notices the identification tattoo on his forearm, partially obscured from view;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: >>00... (obscured by grime, hair and angle). Unlike his own, PAYTON'S tattoo is faded with age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been awake for at least an hour and I still can't remember my... anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, the last time I crawled out of a hyper bunk, it took me... quite a while to get it all back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds his frown as PAYTON squeezes his finger into a wedding ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was... your last flight, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't recall. The Kuiper Belt odyssey? Don't worry, it'll come back, eventually.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kisses the photo of his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've gone through this before. I just can't remember why I would agree to do it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes to close his locker and BOWER motions with a serious tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? I know this is going to sound strange, but do you even know where we're going? I can remember the training, but... not the mission. Know the procedures, not the... destination. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figured you'd tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't even know the ship's name until I saw it-on the console. For all I know this was another damn training exercise-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, it's not. if this is a simulation...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: notices both of their reflections off the mirrored panel inside the locker... revealing their WHITE HAIR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone is taking the joke a little far. He shuts the locker and they exit, the flashlight's beam panning away, taking us into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and PAYTON are standing at the control console, the screens flickering with distortion. BOWER hands him a coffee and PAYTON takes a sip... with a wince of disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of the activators are working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figures. We can ride two hundred thousand tons of space freighter across the galaxy without a dent in the hood, but can't get one good cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flips a few switches with no result of power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without the mainframe, we can't connect. I don't know how we'll ever be able to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in his element at the control desk, flipping open an emergency auxiliary-power panel. He snaps open a handle and he forcefully gives it several rotations with a MOAN of whirling magnetos. The hand-crank allows a dim glow of electricity to the light panels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I- didn't even think of that. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gives him a look with a grin and flips a switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Payton on the con. Respond? This is Lt. Payton of flight Team...? Shit-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five? How do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls up his sleeve, exposing his tattoo ID. PAYTON nods, "good thinking."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lt. Payton of Flight Team Five. Does anyone copy? Anyone... respond? Anyone awake up there? Dead static.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Team Four suppose to be here for the shift rotation. Where could they be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking teamsters. Maybe they couldn't get to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes the third empty sleep-chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where could he have gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gazes off blankly. A RUMBLE of FLICKERING LIGHTS pass and the computer screens slowly fade, going black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The power systems must be free-floating off blown circuits or something. The over-ride grid won't even lock in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta ya think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we need to find a deck of cards and call the union. Distant THUMPS are heard overhead and they freeze... watching the ceiling with uncertainty. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody... is up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm. Ventilation... maybe. Systems keep re-booting after each surge. That could be anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fade as the ship eerily MOANS and CREAKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say we get out of here. I'd rather be up and out then stuck in the trunk. The room is blocked by the two heavy steel doors on either end, security doors ten feet wide. PAYTON leads the way towards one end, gesturing towards the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not far from the bridge but without the circuits locked in... I don't know how we could ever get this thing open. As they approach, their flashlight beams pan across the door to see jagged chips and scratches all along the edges. Tools are scattered on the floor, the control panel ripped open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. Somebody was trying to get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ironic. I think it was built to protect us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing to the third pod) Well, he got out... some how.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches... another SHUDDER that FLICKERS the lights. They watch the ceiling as BOWER counts in his head as it fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cycle is broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not circuitry. Reactor timing is off-set in the core. Seems sporadic, but it's not. Each revolution decreasing before starting over from the beginning. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's trying to reconnect, but it won't until it's reset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. I can't remember my own- but I know everything there is to know about that damn reactor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The training stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I know that... Another SHUDDER approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's twelve revolutions, before recycling. And this one will only last- As they watch the ceiling, their flashlight beams stop on a small ventilation shaft that's been ripped open. They exchange a look and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their lights spill inside an endless steel shaft only a foot and a half in diameter, leading into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now if we only had a monkey and a rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: climbs down as BOWER rotates his jaw with eagerness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our 2nd Lieutenant must have gone this way. Don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the only way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we're better off... waiting here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what? If the mainframe is off-line- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to be able to get to the bridge or even be able to open that door from the other side-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we can at least find out what's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember just how big this ship is, kid? We don't know where that will come out, if at all-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, we can at least try to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't do... Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I have to take a handful of Doxitol just to get in the hyper-bunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're... claustrophobic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can take a lot, that's not one of 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Real boy scout, is that it? You get lost in there and you're a footnote in the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes him over with reluctance.

direction.raw_text: You know there's something wrong. How long can we wait in here before we have to try something? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: (gesturing to 2nd Lt pod) How long did he wait? Silent stare as a SHUDDER passes, flickering the lights.

direction.raw_text: What if no one else is awake and there's no one at the wheel?

direction.raw_text: They dig through compartments, collecting tools. BOWER puts on a boom-mic, clips the radio on his belt and tests the transmitter. PAYTON goes through a drawer of office supplies, handing him an ENVELOPE OPENER.

direction.raw_text: Just in case... (off his look) .there's mail you need to open quickly.

direction.raw_text: tucks it into a zipper pocket and his photograph falls out. PAYTON watches as he tucks it back in and zips up.

direction.raw_text: Wife...?

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I think so.

direction.raw_text: Must be newlyweds. How can you forget something like that?

direction.raw_text: What do-you remember? Anything yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some pieces. (EYES NARROWING) Still a little fuzzy but you're the cocky little shit who wanted the window seat?

direction.raw_text: And you're the cranky old bastard who made me take the aisle.

direction.raw_text: Give it some more time, pal.

direction.raw_text: squeezes inside, pushing himself forward several feet as PAYTON peeks inside behind him. With one last look, BOWER holds the pen-lamp in his teeth and begins to crawl, pushing himself forward on his stomach, only several inches at a time in a rhythmic motion. Grunt, slide, breath. Grunt, slide, breath.

direction.raw_text: Slowly the sound approaches...

direction.raw_text: Grunt, slide, breath. Grunt, slide breath.

direction.raw_text: Dammit.

direction.raw_text: voice crackles over the radio.

direction.raw_text: How we doing?

direction.raw_text: Nothing yet. Christ, not a single vent opening or- Nothing. How about on your end?

direction.raw_text: is seated at the control desk, the light panel fading. He hand-cranks the auxiliary handle and then continues tapping the keys as they flicker with distortion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Power surges keep coming across in longer increments, just like you said. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna keep trying to get inside and run a dyno. Or at least try to get a pizza delivered.

direction.raw_text: frowns as he squints down the shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey?

direction.raw_text: quickly pushes himself forward reaching an intersection in the shaft.

direction.raw_text: Got an intersection here.

direction.raw_text: What are the choices? The light pans to endless shafts in each direction. He SNAPS a glow stick to life, letting it drop down the vertical shaft... silently into nothing.

direction.raw_text: A whole lot of the same... nothing.

direction.raw_text: If you're gonna take a turn let's keep track. That way you can get back if there's no way out.

direction.raw_text: A wall of monitors FLICKER, only offering a quick glance of surveillance cameras on the ship, images too quick and distorted to recognize but resembling empty corridors and vast cargo compartments.

The apparent leader of the pack is HEFLIN, the largest and strongest of the group and he directs the pack with an assortment of odd vocal sounds, deep HISSES from the throat and gargled CACKLES. On command, the one HUNTER flips a lever and the BLUE FLAME crackles back to life with a burst of flammable liquid. The hunt continues, the pack weaving through the debris, following NADIA'S path.
